data.title: Su Casa
data.text: I really like Mexican food and will get it whenever I can. What I liked about this place is that it wasn't your typical Mexican fare. I like your typical Mexican flare, dont get me wrong. Sometimes, however, I'll be in a different town at a different Mexican restaurant and they'll have the exact same menu as the Mexican restaurant where I live. This place had a small menu with a south American Peruvian style section and more Mexican section. The plantains and yucca were yummy. I could have gone for more. My wife had a shrimp dish which she enjoyed. The guacamole wad also good as was the flan. We live in Ohio but will try to make it back next time we are in the area.

data.title: They handled a large crowd very well
data.text: This small restaurant did a great job handling a group on 25 people for lunch. We pre-ordered (which helped) and most of the plates were brought out at the same time. Unfortunately, a few people had to wait a little longer than we had hoped. Nevertheless, the services was very good and food quite tasty!

data.title: Love this place for lunch!
data.text: Dependable and very good service and food.  Mexican and South American specialties are featured.  Owner is often present and really cares.

data.title: Disapointing
data.text:
Wanted Mexician food and wanted to try somewhere new.

Restaurant is in a cute building and has a nicely appointed interior and exterior.  The staff is also very nice and did a good job.

The food was the problem, one of our entries was enchladas the red sauce was different than anything we have tried before and just about uneatable, and sides were very bland.
The other entry was a shrimp dish that had such a strong garlic taste that the entire dish tasted like garlic.

This might be a regional Mexician food problem, but it sure didnt taste like what we are accustomed to in Mexician food.

data.title: Mexican food
data.text: Food was ok, service was very good. Went with a coupon from amazon, so it was reasonable. Has parking which is good in Walnut creek. Would have like a little more spice as we like it hot....does gave a full bar and the monitor were excellent

data.title: Service from a waitress
data.text: There was a young lady, and I think her name is Soudi, I have seldom been impressed by someone's friendliness and caring.  She made me feel at home and she never stopped doing her job.  She would stop at my table and have something to say when she was not busy.  I am an older man (73) and her attention made me feel noticed, more service people need to have that type of spirit or training.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised
data.text: Went with a friend and we both were surprised with our dishes. I ordered the carne asada which was actually a steak well seasoned with grilled green onions, a chili and zucchini. It was really excellent. My friend went with the chili relleno which he said was good but not great.

data.title: Forget the Mexican label, Central American shines here
data.text: If you are stuck at the far end of Walnut Creek, at the Marriott for example, this is a fine place a few blocks off the main drag. Ostensibly Mexican, the owners are from Central America (don't know what country) so I headed to that part of the menu and had a great, rustic seafood paella like concoction. House fried nacho chips, fresh salsa, interesting beer selection, this really hit the spot after a long flight and commute to the suburbs. As noted in the other reviews, this is a family run restaurant, and I felt a real rapport with the waitress (I assume one of the owners). So much so that I felt I had to thank her afterwards for a nice meal, as if I had been to their house. I'd go back to this place if fate ever drew me back to the otherwise dull town of Wlanut a Creek.

data.title: Unique delicious entrees with daily specials
data.text:
This has become one of our favorite local restaurants.  They serve some of the more traditional Mexican dishes, but with their own twist of flavors.  The fun comes with the Central American dishes that you don't usually get anywhere else. The cactus salad, the black beans and rice combination called casamiento, and the fried plantains add extra dimensions of unique flavors to the menu.  Prices are very reasonable and they have daily specials during the week.  Try the tacos dorados on Taco Tuesdays. Yum. 

As a family-run business, the service is personal, friendly, and efficient. Love this place!

data.title: Nice change from traditional Mexican food
data.text:
This was an unexpected delight for my wife and me.  Located away from hectic downtown on N. Broadway, we were surprised to see the menu full of Central American dishes along with Mexican standards.  The service was very good and the food was outstanding.  We both got items from the Central American portion of the menu and we were both pleasantly pleased with the quality and presentation of the food.
Most of the customers appeared to be regulars, as they were chatting casually with the staff.  I consider this place a hidden gem in the restaurant filled town of Walnut Creek.  
Give it a try, I know we will go again!

data.title: Relaxing outdoor seating and yummie food
data.text: We found this jewel during a bike ride and stopped in for what we thought was just another Mexican restaurant, no way, it's more Central American Cuisine and the presentation was amazing, then the tastes, knock-out wonderful, and so many plantains. I was chatting with one of the owners when she shared with me that Yelp called them demanding money or they would only post negative reviews, well shame on you Yelp, shame.

data.title: Very nice family-type place
data.text: The staff was extremely friendly and courteous, and the food was excellent. This was a bright spot in the evening for two travelers staying at the dingy Motel 6 nearby. Colorful decor too.

data.title: Another Birthday Celebration with the 'family' !
data.text: Going to Mi Casa is like dining with family.  Owners Luz, Jose Sr and Jose Jr all make you feel at home.  Can't beat Tuesday Taco night for value, but the other dishes and specialities never disappoint. Enjoyed my birthday with a large group and the service was excellent!

data.title: Wurde empfohlen. Ist eine Empfehlung!
data.text: Bei Nachfrage im Motel wurde uns als erstes dieses kleine, sehr angenehme Restaurant genannt. Und es entsprach unseren Erwartungen.

data.title: Reunion familiar
data.text: Excelente comida y atencion, un lugar acogedor y económico. La familia disfrutó mucho, desde el más pequeño hasta el mayor.
